breve noun [C]
(PRONUNCIATION)
phonetics, language
  specialized a symbol (˘) written or printed above a vowel to show that it is pronounced with a short sound: The breve indicates a short vowel, as opposed to the macron, which indicates long vowels. Compare
macron specialized
More examplesFewer examplesThose single acutes (like the breves) which function as length diacritics are clearly positioned above the vowel.As early as 1821, at least one of the missionaries was using macrons and breves in making handwritten transcriptions of Hawaiian vowels.
